import React, { Component } from 'react' import Axios from 'axios'; import { Form, Button, Row, Col, h1 } from 'react-bootstrap' import '../Form.css' class UserForm extends Component { api = Axios.create({ baseURL: 'http://localhost:5000/', timeout: 2000 }) btnDisabled = () => ( ) btnOn = () => { } state = { firstName: '', lastName: '', username: '', country: '', email: '', password: '', conf_pass: '', policies: '', gender: '' }; handleSubmit = e => { e.preventDefault(); } submitData = async () => { try { let result = await this.api.post('register', this.state); console.log(`Result on Post => ${result}`) console.log(`Result on Post => ${result.data}`) } catch (e) { this.windows.document.alert('Error') console.log(e) } } handleChange = (e) => { // console.log(e.target.name, e.target.value); const { name, value } = e.target; this.setState({ [name]: value }); } render() { let radios = { 'Male': 'male', 'Female': 'female', 'Other': 'others' } let radioBtn = Object.entries(radios).map(([key, value], i) => ( )); return (

Sign Up

It's quick and easy.

First Name Last Name User ID Country Gender

{radioBtn} Email address We'll never share your email with anyone else. Password Confirm Password {/* */} {/* {this.state.policies === 'on' ? this.btnDisabled : this.btnOn} */}

{/* {JSON.stringify(this.state, null, 2)} */}
) } } export default UserForm
